title: Echo: Ava's Short Term Memory
excerpt: Adding context retention to Ava (Artificial Voice Assistant) and integrating WhatsApp messaging.
author: Codem
content:
Project Echo: Restoring Ava's Memory

My most recent project, Ava (Artificial Voice Assistant), initially struggled to retain context across conversation turns. This meant she could not remember details from previous messages, making continuous conversations difficult.

Solution: Short-Term Context Retention

To fix this, I implemented an optional feature at the start of a new conversation to retain context from the most recent previous conversation log.

This is achieved by reposting the prior messages into the system prompt for the new session, effectively giving Ava a 'short-term memory' of our last chat.

The benefit is substantial: if I accidentally refresh the page or intentionally start a new conversation, I can now easily continue exactly from where I left off, ensuring a smoother user experience.

WhatsApp Integration

Furthermore, I integrated my existing WhatsApp module directly into Ava.

This powerful addition allows Ava to message specific contacts on my behalf, based on a pre-approved list I've stored in an array, expanding her utility beyond simple conversation.

You can check out my portfolio for more details on Ava and other projects.
